body:
pytorch was removed by @edouardoyallon in https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio/pull/136
was this deliberate?
The minimal requirement is numpy: maybe some users won't have torch or tf installed. @janden @eickenberg thoughts?

> The minimal requirement is numpy: maybe some users won't have torch or tf installed.

Exactly. The problem is that `import kymatio` fails on the current branch (v2) in a bare virtual environment (which does not include pytorch), because `scattering1d.py` imports torch:

See:
https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio/blob/kymatio-v2/kymatio/scattering1d/scattering1d.py#L7
Ah, actually, this will be solved when #431 gets merged. It's just that we are in limbo between PRs on v2.
Presumably the 2d numpy tests should catch this, though. Any explanation as to why they don't?

rename.to: pip install kymatio fails on bare environment

body:
Renaming to:  `pip install kymatio fails on bare environment`
It would be nice to test that this install works on pure numpy, once the pytorch dependency becomes completely optional.
you can actually try it on the playground of pytest, that'd be awesome if you could do it!(as we'll finish the 1-3D branches)
Cool! So can you confirm that, in Kymatio v0.2, it will be possible to run forward scattering on CPU with neither PyTorch nor TensorFlow installed?

Nice!!
The way i would see it would be to modify the `travis_install.sh` so that it accepts more combinations of installation settings, via env variables:
* `IS_CONDA`: true/false
* `HAS_TENSORFLOW`: true/false
* `HAS_PYTORCH`: true/false

So eight in total. Times the number of Python versions (in our case, three).

Does that make sense?

If so, i can prepare a PR in this direction. Of course, we'd have to restrict to the case in which `HAS_TENSORFLOW` and `HAS_PYTORCH` are both `1` in `.travis.yml` to begin with, but then, once the other v02 PR get merged, we may consider adding the rest simply by updating the Travis YAML file.
